clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Highflow Nasal Oxygen Application in Cesarean Under General Anesthesia and Its Effects on Newborn.
clinical_study.official_title: In the Study; Preoperative Highflow Nasal Oxygen Application in Cesarean Under General Anesthesia and Its Effects on Newborn.

lead_sponsor.agency: Kocaeli Derince Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kocaeli Derince Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Preoperative Highflow Nasal Oxygen Application in Cesarean Under General Anesthesia and Its Effects on Newborn.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients who will undergo caesarean section under general anesthesia will be included in the study.
In the study; preoxygenation is applied to the caesarean sections under general anesthesia in two ways. Group1 includes preoxygenation masked patients.

primary_outcome.description: compare the durations of stay in the intensive care unit and in hospital

arm_group.arm_group_label: preoxygenation mask applied to the cesarean
arm_group.description: In order to protect the mother from hypoxia, preoxygenation is performed with face mask before induction of anesthesia.

arm_group.arm_group_label: high flow nasal oxygenation applied to the ceserian
arm_group.description: In order to protect the mother from hypoxia, preoxygenation is performed with high flow nasal oxygenation mask before induction of anesthesia.

intervention.description: With POINT device (peri-operative insufflatory nasal therapy); patients are heated at higher flow and applied to humidified oxygen.
intervention.arm_group_label: high flow nasal oxygenation applied to the ceserian

intervention.description: In order to protect the mother from hypoxia, preoxygenation is performed with face mask before induction of anesthesia.
intervention.arm_group_label: preoxygenation mask applied to the cesarean
